result.execSummary:

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant James E Gray in court, in custody, with attorney James Walrath.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses motion regarding stun belt. Atty. Walrath states the defense has withdrawn that portion of the post conviction motion. Atty. Walrath makes statements regarding other post conviction motions. State makes statements regarding post conviction motions and objects to all parts listed. Court makes oral ruling. Court denies motion in regards to search issue. Court finds no flaw with the observational identification of the defendant by the witness, Court denies this portion of the motion. Court denies motion regarding Jury Instruction. For reasons set out on the record, court denies motions for post conviction relief.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James E Gray in court, in custody, with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.   Attorney Osborne makes recommendations regarding sentencing.   Attorney Bloch makes statements to the Court regarding sentencing.   Defendant makes statements.  

Count #1
The Court Orders the Following:
Imposed Sentence of:
5 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 )  Concurrent to other counts and consecutive to any other sentence
-	3 Years of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with victims listed in the criminal complaint.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
Defendant to avoid any person or place associated with the sale, distribution, or use of illegal controlled substances
To have no contact with any known drug users or locations where illegal drugs are stored or sold
Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Restitution: $909.25 to be paid to Capital One as a condition of extended supervision
Restitution: $318.12 to be paid to FIA Card Services as a condition of extended supervision

Cost: $278.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
DNA surcharge: waived 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on July 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.
from Oshkosh CI.
Jury question @ 3:45 pm.

Case called for day 2 of the jury trial.  Defendant James E Gray in court, in custody, with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court makes initial statements to the parties.  Defendant makes statements regarding his counsel.  Court makes statements regarding the defendant's comments.  13 jurors return to the courtroom.  State calls witness Aleksandar Simic, sworn in, testified.  State calls witness Dominic Schroeder, sworn in, testified.  State calls Officer Philip Doney sworn in, testified.  Court excuses the jury for a short recess.  Court addresses the objection to exhibit #3 being admitted.  Attorney Osborne makes statements regarding a witness who did not return today even though she is under subpoena.  Court reconvenes at 10:14 am.  State moves for a warrant be issued for the witness, Constance Vaughn, for her nonappearance on a subpoena.  Court finds Constance Vaughn in contempt of court for her nonappearance.  Jury returns to the courtroom.  State recalls witness Raime Townsend, sworn in, testified.  State makes record that it would have called witness Constance Vaughn at this time, but she didn't appear.  State calls witness Detective Craig Mayer, sworn in, testified.  State calls witness Shelly Zais, sworn in, testified.  State rests.  Court excuses the jury at this time.  Attorney Bloch moves to dismiss.  Court denies the motion to dismiss as stated.  Court addresses the defendant's option to testify.  Court takes a lunch recess, to resume at 12:30 to go over jury instructions, jurors to return at 12:45 pm.  Court reconvenes at 12:30 pm.   Defendant advises he no longer wishes to testify on his own behalf.  Court addresses this matter with the defendant.  Court addresses proposed verdicts.  Parties approve proposed verdicts.  Court goes over jury instructions.  Jury returns to the Courtroom at 12:53 pm.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Court addresses the jury as to the status of the case.  Court reads jury instructions.  Attorney Osborne makes closing statements.  Court excuses the jury for a short recess.  Court reconvenes at 2:07 pm.  Attorney Bloch gives closing arguments.  Attorney Osborne calls a sidebar at 2:42 pm.  Attorney Osborne gives rebuttal closing arguments.  Court reads jury instructions.  Bailiff sworn in.  Alternate juror name read and excused.  Jurors excused to begin deliberations at 2:58 pm.  Court addresses the sidebar called.  Jury submits a written question at 3:45 pm.  Court reconvenes at 3:51 pm to address question.  Court sends the jury exhibits 13 and 14 as requested.  Jury submits a written question at 4:00 pm.  Court reconvenes at 4:06 pm to address the the question.  Court sends a written response back to the jury.  Jury submits a written question marked by jurors "4:40 pm" received by court at 4:20 pm.   Court reconvenes at 4:28 pm to address the the question.  Court sends a written response back to the jury.

Jurors reach verdicts at 4:43 p.m.   Jurors enter courtroom at 4:48 p.m.   Court reads verdict on Count #1.  Foreperson erroneously signed both verdict forms for Count #1 as guilty and as not guilty.  Foreperson wrote "error" on not guilty form as foreperson indicated that intention and verdict by jurors is "guilty".  Court polls the jurors as to verdict on Count #1.  Jurors find Defendant guilty of Count #1 - 5.  Court polls the jurors again as to verdicts for Counts #2-5.  Court gives jurors final instructions and dismisses jurors at 4:55 p.m.  State moves fo judgment on verdicts.  Attorney Bloch objects.  Court enters judgment on Counts #1-5.  Court revokes bail.  Defendant indicated to Attorney Bloch that his medication ran out that he was receiving at Oshkosh Correctional.  Court orders presentence investigation-due by 7/1/16.  DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH.
from the Court to the jurors.
Juror's Selection and peremptory challenges filed.
Voir Dire List, Random Listing Report, Jury Seating Chart, and random alternate list filed.
filed by Attorney Osborne in Court.
filed by Attorney Bloch in Court.

Defendant James E Gray in court, in custody, with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties and the Court make initial jury trial statements.  Court calls for the jurors at 8:43 am.  Attorney Osborne moves to amend the information.  Court grants request and amends the information.  Potential jurors arrive at 9:08 am.  23 potential jurors seated into the jury box.  Court makes initial statements to the potential jury.  Potential jury sworn in.  Court explains the jury process to the jurors.  Court begins voir dire.  Juror #8 struck for cause.  Court calls juror #24 to the jury box.  Voir dire continues.  Sidebar called at 10:23 am.  Parties make their jury selection.  Court reads the 13 jurors selected.  Jurors sworn in.  Court excuses the jury for a short recess.  Attorney Bloch moves to exclude witnesses.  Court excludes all witnesses.  Court addresses the sidebar.  Court reconvenes at 10:52 am.  Court reads opening jury instruction.  Attorney Osborne gives opening statements.  Attorney Bloch reserves his opening statement.  State calls witness, K. L. W. J., sworn in, testified.  State calls witness Officer Raime Townsend, sworn in, testified. Court breaks for lunch to resume at 1:00 pm.  Court reconvenes at 1:00 pm.  State calls witness SGT Joseph Ipabec, sworn in, testified.  Court excuses the jury for a short recess.  One of the jurors has a question, court addresses the matter with the parties outside of the jury.  Court reconvenes at 2:07 pm.  State calls witness Gary Durham, sworn in, testified.  State calls witness Kevin Doffek, sworn in, testified.  State calls witness Kevin Walker, sworn in, testified.  Court takes a short recess.  Court reconvenes at 4:15 pm.  State calls witness Robert Eastham, sworn in, testified.  Court ends for the evening, to reconvene on 5/4/2016

Court orders Attorney Bloch have unlimited access to discuss trial matters with his client on 5/3/2016 after court.

Defendant James E Gray in court, in custody, with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court hears attorney Bloch's motion in limine.  Court denies the motion to amend the charge.  Trial remains on the calendar.

Defendant James E Gray in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was produced from Oshkosh Correctional Institution, defendant states his release date from Oshkosh is in December of 2016.  Court addresses Attorney Wolff's motion to withdraw.  Attorney Wolff makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court addresses speedy trial demand. Court releases Attorney Wolff as counsel, he was the 5th counsel appointed.  Court tolls the time limits.  Attorney Osborne makes statements.  Court takes the matter off the trial calendar.  Court sets a hearing.  Defendant to appear by phone for the next hearing date.  Court will wait to hear if the public defenders office will appoint new counsel.  Hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.
